channel.title: Swaping Client Windows
channel.description:
Hi All,
Is there any way to swap Client Windows in SCAR while running a script?
Thanks for any input.

item.title: Swaping Client Windows
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

The way to properly swap windows in scar would be do something like this btw this is straight out of the Test folder that came with your scar Kaits’ gave us all the information and even showd you how to use it
[php]
program New;
var
W, H: Integer;
begin
GetClientDimensions(W, H);
Writeln(‘W=’ + IntToStr(W));
Writeln(‘H=’ + IntToStr(H));
if(FindWindowTitlePart(‘SCAR’, False))then
Writeln(‘found scar’);
MoveMouseSmooth(0, 0);
Sleep(100);
if(FindWindowBySize(766, 504))then
Writeln(‘found RS by size’);
MoveMouseSmooth(0, 0);
end.
[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: Swaping Client Windows
item.dc:creator: @Fink Fink
item.description:
@Fink wrote:

Grrr I thought I tried that and it didnâ€™t work :mad:

I obviously didnâ€™t have your sanction

So the way I have it now is with the 3 windows Iâ€™m working on in a stack.
The window I want to swap to lowest, SCAR next and then the working window on top.
Now keeping all the integers positive to make things easy (this may have been where I was going wrong b4) I have the script click SCARs title in the task bar.
Then I have the â€˜drag to targetâ€™ target its own menu bar so there is less chance of moving the tools all over the place.
Finally It targets the new client.

SUCCESS!!

Thanks for pointing me in the right direction again Doomsday

Read full topic

item.title: Swaping Client Windows
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

Well there is one way, what you do is you have scar click on the title in the task bar then click on scars target thing, then you hod mouse and target your new client.

Is that what you wanted?

Read full topic
